marklogic.body:
Dear Bill,
I have been reading your blog the last couple of months which is really very interesting. However I have not found an answer on this :
I buy UVXY today at 19$.
If the contango of the VIX futures persists for the next 4-5 months , will UVXY keep dropping as its IV will gradually decay due to the monthly "roll yield" thing ?
in other words, assuming VIX stays around 15-17 for the enxt 4-5 months or assuming VIX Spot rises when S&P drops but the VIX futures rise accordingly too (so the contango will Always be there) , does this entail that UVXY will keep dropping gradually ?
in other words, is the backwardation the ONLY factor that impacts the IV of UVXY positively and makes UVXY rise ?
in other words, if VIX Spot rises back to 30 gradually and slowly every day (so the VIX futures also rise with the same pace too) for the next 3 months without any backwardation occuring, won't UVXY hit 50-60 but will UVXY keep dropping from the current levels ?
If i want to short S&P should I buy TZA instead ? Does TZA follow S&P drops correctly ?
Please reply to me asap as I am in despair with my recent purchase of UVXY at 26 $ and I have lost 25% in 3 days.
Thank you very much in advance.
